revised_title: The Pioneering Collaboration of Robert and Gertrude Robinson, J.B.S. Haldane, and Muriel Wheldale Onslow in Chemical Genetics
tldr: This article recounts the collaboration between Robert and Gertrude Robinson, J.B.S. Haldane, and Muriel Wheldale Onslow in the 1930s, which significantly contributed to the field of chemical genetics. Their work focused on the biochemical nature of gene action and the biosynthesis of plant pigments, particularly anthocyanins. This collaboration laid the foundation for future research in chemical genetics and the understanding of the relationship between genetics and biochemistry.
